0.name: The Gate of a Dwarven Outpost
desc: To your north lies a massive stone gate.  The craftsmanship could only
be the work of Dwarven hands, but the scorch marks and huge hole where
the portcullis was ripped out gives you the idea they may not still
be around ....

1.name: The Gate
desc: As you walk through the gate you try to decide whether you are more awed by
the size of the gate, or the large number of scorch marks that are visible
on it.  While you look around you are thankful for the respite from the dust
and heat of the desert.  To the north lies the entry hall of the outpost and
to the south lies the inhospitable desert.

2.name: The Entry Hall
desc: This room was the entrance hall to the outpost.  You seem to remember your
mother saying something about dwarves doing nothing halfway...  Anyway this
room is so huge it disappears into darkness to the north.  You can see
passages leading west and east.  The gate is to the south from here.

3.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are in the southwest corner of the entry hall.  The far north is still
shrouded in darkness.  Even in this remote portion of the hall scorch marks
are visible.  A tiny bit to the east lies the gate and a tiny bit to the
north a passage exits to the west.

4.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are in the southeast corner of the entry hall.  The far north is still
shrouded in darkness.  Even in this remote portion of the hall scorch marks
are visible.  A tiny bit to the west lies the gate and a tiny bit to the
north a passage exits to the east.

5.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are in the middle of the entry hall.  The floor is covered with scorch
marks.  From the north a wave of heat assails you.  Looking up you see a
mound of assorted valuables.  This seems to be the source of the heat.  To
the east and west passages run off into darkness.  The way south will lead
you back to the gate.

6.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are on the west side of the entry hall.  There is a passage exiting west
here.  You notice that the wall and floor is covered with scorch marks.  The
gate lies to the southeast and a huge mound of valuables lies to the
northeast

7.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are on the east side of the entry hall.  There is a passage exiting east
here.  You notice that the wall and floor is covered with scorch marks.  The
gate lies to the southwest and a huge mound of valuables lies to the
northwest.

8.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You seem to be in the middle of the entry hall.  From here you can see four
passageways - two leave west and the other two lead east.  If you were still
standing on the ground you would be waist deep in valuables, but they are so
tightly packed that they support the combined weight of you and your armour.
A small distance to the south you can make out the gate.  The mound rises in
front of you to the north.

9.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are on the west side of the entry hall.  A mound of valuables of all
types rises to the east.  This is the the source of the heat that is making
you uncomfortable.  There are two passages exiting west - ones a tiny bit
north of you and the other a tiny bit to the south.

10.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are on the east side of the entry hall.  A mound of valuables of all
types rises to the west.  This is the the source of the heat that is making
you uncomfortable.  There are two passages exiting east - one is a tiny bit
to the north and the other a tiny bit to the south.

11.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are climbing a mound of valuables.  You reach the top and look upon ...
a huge impression in the pile.  You guess if you stood in the middle of it
you would be waist deep.  The outline of the impression seems uncomfortably
familiar but you can't quite place it.  To the east and west passages exit
the entry hall.  To the south is the mound that you climbed over and to the
north you can see the top of a throne sticking out of the mound and the
outline of a door behind it.

12.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are on the east side of the entry hall.  There is a passage exiting east
here.  There is a huge mound of valuables rising to the west.  The heat
emanating from there is nigh unbearable.  You begin to wonder exactly how
well your armour conducts heat....

13.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are on the west side of the entry hall.  There is a passage exiting west
here.  There is a huge mound of valuables rising to the east.  The heat
emanating from causes you to make sure your clothing isn't getting singed.

14.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are standing in front of a throne half buried in all sorts of valuables.
Behind the throne is a door which exits to the north.  To the east and west
lie the northern corners of the entry hall.  To the south rises the mound.
This was once a magnificent throne.  The red felt of the cushions are now
tattered and the sturdy frame scratched from the numerous jewels and
precious stones surrounding it.

15.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are in the northwest corner of the entry hall.  The mound tapers off
here.  You can now see numerous scorch marks on the floor and walls.  To
the west you can see a throne poking out of the mound and a doorway right
behind it.  A tiny bit to the south a hallway exits west.

16.name: The Entry Hall
desc: You are in the northeast corner of the entry hall.  The mound tapers off
here.  You can now see numerous scorch marks on the floor and walls.  To
the east you can see a throne poking out of the mound and a doorway right
behind it.  A tiny bit to the south a hallway exits east.

17.name: Northern Hallway
desc: You are in a hall that only royalty and their trusted servants have used
before you.  The door to the south slams shut and the weight on the door
from the other side will ensure you don't get out that way.  The hallway
continues to the north.

18.name: Northern Hallway
desc: As you tread in the steps of royalty you almost feel like royalty yourself.
You stand straighter, hold your head high, and strut along like you own the
place.  There is a door to the west and a curtain to the east.  The hallway
continues north and south.

19.name: Northern Hallway
desc: The hallway ends here in a door that is encrusted with gold and jewels.  You
can tell that any attempt at prying them out would be futile.  The hallway
exits to the south.

20.name: Guest's Chambers
desc: This room was once used for visiting dignitaries and trusted family, now it
is covered with dust.  It was obviously a fine room at one time with
tapestries and a fine four-poster canopied bed.  There is a door to the east.

21.name: Guest's Chambers
desc: This room is decked out in the finest of finery.  There is a canopied
four-poster bed, a large bureau, and a body length mirror.  A fine curtain
conceals the exit to the west.

22.name: The Royal Chambers
desc: This room is the epitome of luxuriousness.  The plush four-poster bed looks as
if it could sleep a good sized family comfortably.  The ivory wrought bureau
and gold framed mirror only emphasise the quality of the furnishings.  A plush
carpet covers the center of the room.  You think you can see the outline of a
door to the east.

23.name: The Royal Treasury
desc: This is it the fabled treasury room for the outpost (where did you think it
would be located?  Under a trap door beneath that plush carpet?).  Where you
expected to see mounds of gold and jewels there is naught the be had.  Either
the outpost was broke when it was attacked or the treasure has since then
been relocated.

24.name: Secret Passage!
desc: As you go down you feel a strange sensation pass through your body.  Your
vision blurs and there is a shifting of sorts but you can't quite tell what
is happening.

25.name: Weight Room
desc: There are well spaced weights here - it looks quite organised even though it
has been a long time since they were used.  The room continues to the north
and east.

26.name: Weight Room
desc: Here are a number of bench presses and you are startled to notice that the
lowest possible choice is 150 lbs.  The room extends south and west.

27.name: Weight Room
desc: Free weights line the mirror covered walls.  This was where warriors could
work on or admire their form.  The room continues to the south and east.

28.name: Practice Room
desc: This spacious chamber stretches south and east.  Most of it is just empty
space where youngsters and warriors in training can spar.  There is padding
piled up against the wall.  A nice think coat of dust covers everything.

29.name: Practice Room
desc: There are some wooden swords here and even a couple wooden shields.  There is
an opening in the north wall here that looks to lead into the weight room.
The practice room continues to the south and west.

30.name: Practice Room
desc: There are some targets lined up against the wall here.  There is also a pile
of quarrels and crossbows.  The quarrels look as though they would crumble in
your hand.  The chamber continues to the north and west of you.

31.name: Practice Room
desc: There are several wooden shields and axes lying here.  The floor is very
scuffed and well-used but there still remains a thick layer of dust over
everything.  The chamber continues to the north and east.

35.name: Secret Passage!
desc: As you go down you feel a strange sensation pass through your body.  Your
vision blurs and there is a shifting of sorts but you can't quite tell what
is happening.

36.name: The High Priest's Chambers
desc: This chamber is sparsely furnished, containing only a cot and lumpy mattress,
a small bureau, and a wardrobe.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly
under the bed.  You can see the outline of a trap door in the center of the
floor.

37.name: Temple Hallway
desc: You are in a long hallway.  There is a door to the north.  The hallway to the
south has doors leaving east and west along the length of it.

38.name: Temple Hallway
desc: There are doorways to the east and west here.  The hallway continues north a
short distance before ending in a door.

39.name: Temple Hallway
desc: There are doorways to the east and west here.
The hallway continues north and south.

40.name: Temple Hallway
desc: There are doorways to the east and west here.  Looking south you can see a
door outlined with a soft white light quite a bit in the distance.  The
hallway continues north and south.

41.name: Temple Hallway
desc: There are doorways to the east and west here.  Looking south you can see a
door outlined with a soft white light quite a bit in the distance.  The
hallway continues north and south.

42.name: Temple Hallway
desc: There are doorways to the east and west here.  A tiny bit to the south you can
see a door outlined with a soft white light.  The hallway continues north and
south.

43.name: Temple Hallway
desc: There is a door to the south.  It is outlined by a soft white glow.  The
hallway continues to the north.

44.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a hallway to the east.

45.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a doorway to the east.

46.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
A book can be seen partially tucked under the prayer mat.  There is a doorway
to the east.

47.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
A Hymn Book lies on the cot, it seems much read.  There is a doorway to the
east.

48.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a doorway to the east.

49.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a doorway to the west.

50.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a doorway to the west.

51.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a doorway to the west.

52.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
There is a doorway to the west.

53.name: Cleric's Chambers
desc: This room is sparsely furnished containing only a cot and a threadbare blanket
with a lumpy mattress.  A prayer mat can be seen tucked neatly under the bed.
A book of prayer lies on the floor next to the bed.  There is a doorway to the
west.

54.name: Temple
desc: You are standing in the northern entrance to an ancient Dwarven temple.  A
soft white glow fills the chamber.  Directly south of you are some benches
and a little past that is an alter and some more benches.  You may leave in
any direction.

55.name: Temple
desc: You are in the northwest corner of the temple.  To the south you can see a
path leading through the benches.  As you look south a feeling of pure and
utter evil flow through you.  You can continue either south or east.

56.name: Temple
desc: You are in the northeast corner of the temple.  To the south you can see a
path leading through the benches.  As you look south a feeling of goodness
flows through you.  You can continue south or west.

57.name: Temple
desc: This area is dominated by benches.  You think that this would be an okay seat
during services but the benches to the south are inviting to the pious at
heart.  The source of the soft glow seems to be the alter.

58.name: Temple
desc: You are on a path betwixt the benches which leads to the alter located to
the southwest of your position.  As you stand in this area a feeling of
peace and vigor fills you.

59.name: Temple
desc: As you enter this area a sense of evil washes over you.  You can also feel
your magical abilities seeping back into you from the surrounding area.  The
alter is to the south of you.

60.name: Temple
desc: You have reached the center of the temple and the alter lies at your feet.
You are positive that it is the source of the soft white light surrounding
you.  The alter itself has some marvellous woodworked figures.  Among the key
figures engraved on it that you can recognise are the Dwarven Gods of good,
neutrality, and evil.  You can leave in any direction.

61.name: Temple
desc: You are among the benches to the east of the alter.  You feel at peace with
yourself and your surroundings.  You health seems to be improving as you look
around.  The alter seems to be the source of the soft white light.

62.name: Temple
desc: You stand among the benches to the west of the alter.  You feel as if someone
were working you over with a whip as you steadily gain in health.  You can
identify the alter as the source of the soft white light.

63.name: Temple
desc: Walking among the benches gives you an eerie feeling - almost a sense of
foreboding that is at odds with this place.  It sort of reminds you of your
childhood and dressing up in your Sunday best.

64.name: Temple
desc: You are on a path leading to and from the alter, which lies to the northeast.
A feeling of peace comes over you as you absorb magical energies from the
surrounding area.  You can continue north, south, and west.

65.name: Temple
desc: You are on a path leading to the alter to the northeast of you.  A sense of
utter revulsion of anything humanoid, including yourself causes you to feel
the closet thing to joy possible for one of your kind.  It seems as if little
demons are rubbing life into your feet.

66.name: Temple
desc: This part of the temple is filled with benches.  You can easily imagine rows
upon rows of dwarves kneeling here giving thanks.  Passages exit south to
both the east and the west.  To the north is the body of the temple.

67.name: Temple
desc: The light flashes brilliantly then fades to a soft white glow.  You are in
the Southwest corner of what looks to be an ancient Dwarven temple.  There is
an altar to the north and benches down the middle of this good-sized chamber.
The funny thing though is that the benches don't have any dust on them.  Yet
you would guess you were the first to enter this hallowed chamber in decades.

68.name: Temple
desc: The light almost blinds you as you enter this chamber before settling down to
a soft white glow.  You are in an ancient Dwarven temple.  The altar lies a
good ways north and there are benches covering the most of the center of the
temple.

69.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: The light is so bright it would hurt your eyes if it wasn't so soft and
yielding.  As you get nearer you feel as if your heart will burst...

70.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: Your heart begins to quicken and you wonder what spectacle awaits your
mortal eyes as you stare enchanted at the amazingly soft yet brillent white
glow .

71.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: As you head north the glow brightens and gets stronger.  You feel no fear
and are remarkably peaceful.  The darkness to the south of you is an
unwanted memory.

72.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: The first thing you notice is a soft glowing coming from the north.  A wave
of peace and serenity pass over you.  You barely spare a second glance to
the darkness to the east.

73.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: Looking west you can just make out a turn to the north.  The way east is
obscured in darkness.  The tension eases away and you feel at one with
yourself and your environment.

74.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: You can feel a tremendous wave of heat coming from the east.  The nice cool
brease draws you west into the darkened hallway like a moth to flame....

75.name: Southwest Hallway
desc: The hallway continues into darkness to the west.  The entry hall lies to
your east. A cool brease is blowing from the west.

76.name: Northwest Hallway
desc: This hallway seems to have been well used at one time, but now it seems void
of life.  If you stand still for a second you can hear the tramping of boots
from ages past.  The way north is obscured by a brilliant light.

77.name: Northwest Hallway
desc: The light grows increasingly brighter to the north.  As you look around you
realize that the hallway doesn't continue to the west, but instead turns
northward.

78.name: Northwest Hallway
desc: You practically throw yourself into the hallway to escape the heat!  You can
feel a cool breeze coming from the west, but then anything would be cool
compared to that.  There also seems to be a soft white glow coming from
a northern passageway a little to the west of you.

79.name: Northeast Hallway
desc: As you enter this hallway you notice the scorch marks covering the wall like
paint.  The stench of fear fills your nostrils and raises the hair on your
neck.  The hallway continues to the east and exits to the entry hall in the
west.

80.name: Northeast Hallway
desc: This must have been the hallway for the living area at one point.  Through
an open doorway to the north you can see what looks like a baracks and to
the south is a door.  Above the door is a sign that reads "Armoury".  The
hallway continues east and west.

81.name: Northeast Hallway
desc: The stench of fear (or is it sweat) is strongest here.  A rough-hewn passage
lies to the south.  This hallway continues to the east and west.  To the
north more bunks can be seen through the open doorway.

82.name: Northeast Hallway
desc: This hallway ends in a cul de sac with three doors.  The one to the north is
open and seems to be more barracks.  The one to the east has a sign above it
proclaiming "Ye ole weight room".  The one to the south seems to be of similar
purpose with a sign stating simply "Ye practice here".

83.name: Barracks
desc: Many bunks line the walls.  By each bunk is a small footlocker.  The room
seems quite orderly.  The barracks continues to the north.

84.name: Barracks
desc: There are a few more bunks here but most of the room is taken up by two large
round tables and a number of chairs around them.  There is a ale pitcher on
its side here and a deck of cards lies strewn across one table.  The barracks
exits to the south.

85.name: Barracks
desc: This used to be living quarters for the dwarves stationed here but now mounds
of dirt and stone fill the room.  To the north you can see the bunks that
were moved there presumably to make room for the dirt.

86.name: Barracks
desc: There is very little room to move about here.  The disassembled bunks lie in
neat piles and you can see the tables leaning against the walls.  There is
dirt piled here too.  The rooms exits to the south.

87.name: Barracks
desc: These barracks are more spread out and have partitions dividing them.  The
footlockers are much larger and the mattresses look a little thicker.  This
must have been for visiting families and such.  The Barracks continue to the
north and exits to the south.

88.name: Barracks
desc: There is a small stage here in addition to a few more bunks.  This area is
quite disorderly - due apparently to the haste in which the inhabitants
packed.  The room exits to the south.

89.name: The Armory
desc: You see many equipment racks here.  Some of them still have swords and shields
from days past.  There is a door to the north.

90.name: Connecting Passage
desc: This passage was definitely not planned.  The walls are very rough and you must
stoop to get through.  The few blunted and broken swords lead you to believe
that this was used as an escape tunnel.  It exits north and south.

91.name: Southeast Hallway
desc: This hallway was once well used as evidenced by the many scruff marks on the
floor and walls.  Now a thick layer of dust has settled over everything.  The
hallway continues to the east and exits into the entrance hall to the west.

92.name: Southeast Hallway
desc: This hallway was well-used at one time, but now it is filled with dust.  It
continues to the east and west.

93.name: Southeast Hallway
desc: The hallway forms a 'T' intersection here.  Several odour's vie for dominance
the more pleasant emanating from the south.  The hallway continues to the
north, south, and west.

94.name: Southeast Hallway
desc: In this hallway you think you can smell the odur of cooking food.  But the
smell eludes you and only has the effect of making you hungry and wary at
the same time.  There is a door to the south and the hallway continues to
the north.

95.name: Dining Room
desc: This is a huge room that was obviously used as an eating area.  There are
tables and benches filling the room.  The dining room continues to the
west.  A swinging door leaves east, you presume to the kitchen.

96.name: Dining Room
desc: The tables here aren't in such good shape as those in the other dining area.
Most seem rotted through and they are strewn in disarray.  What catches your
eye are the smaller tables, that were obviously used by the children.  The
dining room continues to the east.

97.name: Kitchen
desc: The pots and pans in this room seem to have been of the finest quality
and still maintain their rightful position on the wall.  There are meat
cleavers and other knives hanging on the center bench.  There is a door
to the north.

98.name: Chef's Quaters
desc: Even after years of disuse this room is still plagued by the grease from
the Chef.  There is a door to the south.

99.name: Weight Room
desc: This is the entrance to the weight area.  Though it is quite extensive you
realise that this was primarily a military outpost and dwarves are famous
for keeping in shape.  The room extends to the north and east.
